title: Ferrari fastest in wet-dry test
text:
F1 Testing: Kimi Raikkonen fastest in wet-dry Test One finale By James Galloway in Barcelona Last Updated: 02/03/17 5:13pm Kimi Raikkonen and Ferrari returned to the top of the timesheet on the final day of 2017's first test - but the session largely proved a damp squib as teams tested Pirelli's new wet tyres in artificially damp conditions. 
The searing pace of Day Three was not replicated on Thursday as water tankers twice doused the circuit, first ahead of the morning session and then during the lunch break. 
As the track dried towards the end of the two sessions, slick tyres were used with Raikkonen posting a quickest lap on softs of 1:20.872 - his best of the week but just under a second down on team-mate Sebastian Vettel's Wednesday benchmark. 
Lewis Hamilton did not run as scheduled in the morning as Mercedes ran into their first mechanical trouble of the winter, as an electrical fault kept the W08 in the garage for several hours. Ted Kravitz joins James Galloway trackside to wrap up the first test in Barcelona and look at which teams are emerging as contenders 
Once the problem was fixed late in the morning, Hamilton decided to give what was left of the session over to Valtteri Bottas with the Finn due in the car for the afternoon in any case. 
Bottas still completed 68 laps and finished eighth fastest, with Mercedes ending the week with the quickest overall time and the most number of laps completed. 
Max Verstappen posted his best time of the test to take second for Red Bull, with Sergio Perez third for Force India and Stoffel Vandoorne, despite use of the ultrasofts late on, seventh for McLaren. Jolyon Palmer ended the test third for Renault. 
More to follow... 
The second F1 pre-season test starts on Tuesday March 7 and the Sky Sports F1 Digital team will be providing live commentary from dawn until dusk on all four days while Sky Sports News HQ will also deliver live updates from trackside.
